value.0: Piss of ye bloody freak or ah will put ye where ye belong! That be six feet under zhe ground, ja?!
I cannot remember everyzing!  Nau... where was I? O, six feet under zhe ground, ja?!
Hail there, frailling. I am in ye debt! What can I do for you?
Fine, fine... ah will tell ye a story of men and women of real legend, nah frailings. Which one would ye wish to hear?
Hail there, <lad/lass>. I am Sigmund... and you made me SMILE! How can I be of service?
Ja, which one would ye like to hear, <lad/lass>?
Thank ye for helping Grunhild smile and laugh again. I am already feeling inspiration return tm my heart.

<StartAction>He looks upon Grunhild with worried eyes</Start>
 
You have found what you need to help her?

<StartAction>He looks upon Grunhild with worried eyes</Start>
 
You have found what you needed to help her?

<StartAction>He looks upon Grunhild with worried eyes</Start>

I worry so... will she ever smile again?

<StartAction>He looks upon Grunhild with worried eyes</Start> 

Still she will not smile or laugh.

Ja? 

<StartAction>He lets out a long sigh turning his gaze from Grunhild to look at you</Start>

Don't bother asking me to tell spin you a tale, I have no interest in playing any more.
Ja, you have. I've told zhem that I do not wish to sing or play anymore.

<StartAction>He turns to look at Grunhild once more</Start>

See zhe beautiful lass over there?

She is the fairest maiden of our people. Zhere was a time when she could light zhis hall with her laughter and smile, but it has been to long since she has smiled. No I find zhat I cannot play or sing again, not until I see zhat smile and hear zhat laughter once again.
She morns for zhe loss of her love. If only someone could help end her mourning, zhen maybe she would smile and laugh, and I could sing the legends of our people once again.

Ja?

<StartAction>He lets out a long sigh turning his gaze from Grunhild to look at you</Start>

 Don't bother asking me to tell spin you a tale, I have no interest in playing anymore.

But... I helped you?

<StartAction>*grabs axe*</Start>

Where was I? Ahh...
Alright alright.. I am off!
No, perhaps later.
Yes, I was hoping you could honor us with telling a tale of your kin, skald.
The fall of Benwick
Óðins Rune Song
The ballad of the northern maiden
The tale of Lord Dietrich Øvind
The song of King Hrolf
The Legend of Lord Hallstein Øvind
The lament of Frida the fair.
No, perhaps later.
Please grace us with one of your tales.
The tale of Lord Dietrich Øvind
The fall of Benwick
Óðins Rune Song
The ballad of the northern maiden
The song of King Hrolf
The Legend of Lord Hallstein Øvind
The lament of Frida the fair.
You are welcome Sigmond.
As soon as she drinks this potion, she will be able to smile and laugh once more. I will give it to her now.
Soon Sigmund, soon she will smile again
I may be able to help her yet, I know what I must do.
I may be able to help her yet.
Um, actually I came to talk to you on behalf of Lord Ovind.
Why don't you want to play any more Sigmund?
Why is she so sad?
I will talk to her and see if I can help her smile once more.
Okay, maybe some other time.
